episodeTitle: Freedom Taken Away! The Nobles' Plot Closing in on the Brothers!
description: Luffy, Ace, and Sabo search Gray Terminal for supplies when they are captured by the Bluejam Pirates. Sabo is forced to return to High Town where he discovers the nobles' sinister plan to burn down Gray Terminal.

events.title: Brothers Search Gray Terminal
events.description: After their hideout is destroyed by a storm, Luffy, Ace, and Sabo arrive at Gray Terminal to search for materials to rebuild. Luffy expresses his desire to find a telescope.
events.significance: Sets up the episode's central conflict as the brothers unknowingly walk into a trap set by the nobles and Bluejam Pirates.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's innocent desire while searching through the garbage of Gray Terminal

events.title: Sabo Finds the Telescope
events.description: While searching for parts, Sabo discovers a telescope but is immediately surrounded by the Bluejam Pirates. The telescope will become a symbol of Sabo's broken dreams.
events.significance: The telescope represents Luffy's wish and becomes a powerful symbol when it breaks, marking the end of Sabo's freedom and dreams with his brothers.

quotes.text: I didn't know one of the three infamous brats was a Noble.
quotes.speaker: Bluejam
quotes.context: Bluejam reveals he knows Sabo's secret identity

events.title: Three Brothers Fight Bluejam Pirates
events.description: Ace and Luffy appear to help Sabo, and all three brothers put up a fierce fight against the Bluejam Pirates until Bluejam pulls out a gun and they are overpowered.
events.significance: Demonstrates the brothers' bond and their fighting skills, but also shows they are still children who can be overwhelmed by adult pirates with firearms.

events.title: Outlook III Arrives to Claim Sabo
events.description: Sabo's biological father, Outlook III, arrives at Gray Terminal having hired the Bluejam Pirates to retrieve his runaway son. He shows disgust when Ace's blood touches him.
events.significance: Reveals the class divide and prejudice that exists in the Goa Kingdom, and shows why Sabo ran away from his noble family.

quotes.text: You got your trashy kid's blood all over me!
quotes.speaker: Outlook III
quotes.context: Outlook III's disgust when blood from Ace gets on him, showing his contempt for non-nobles

events.title: Sabo's Sacrifice for His Brothers
events.description: Fearing that Bluejam will kill Ace and Luffy, Sabo tearfully agrees to return with his father, sacrificing his freedom and dreams to protect his brothers. He drops and breaks the telescope.
events.significance: This is a pivotal character moment showing Sabo's love for his brothers and his willingness to sacrifice everything for them. The broken telescope symbolizes his shattered dreams of freedom.

quotes.speaker: Sabo
quotes.context: Sabo's declaration as he agrees to go with his father to save Ace and Luffy

events.title: Ace and Luffy Join Bluejam's Crew
events.description: Taken to Bluejam's hideout, Ace and Luffy are offered positions on his pirate crew. They accept, unaware they are being used in the nobles' plot to burn Gray Terminal.
events.significance: Sets up the brothers' unwitting involvement in the Gray Terminal fire, showing how the Bluejam Pirates manipulate them.

events.title: Sterry's First Appearance
events.description: Sabo returns to High Town and meets Sterry, the boy his parents adopted to replace him as their heir. Sterry is condescending and reveals he knows about the nobles' plans.
events.significance: Introduces Sterry, who will later become a significant character in the story, and shows the calculating nature of Sabo's family.

quotes.speaker: Sterry
quotes.context: Sterry's first words to Sabo, hinting at the danger Sabo escaped

events.title: Discovery of the Gray Terminal Fire Plot
events.description: Sterry cryptically tells Sabo that Gray Terminal will be burned to make the country 'clean' for an upcoming World Noble visit. Sabo realizes the horrifying scope of the nobles' plan to eliminate everyone in Gray Terminal.
events.significance: Reveals the depths of the nobles' cruelty and their willingness to commit mass murder for appearances. This is a major world-building moment showing the dark side of the World Government's influence.

quotes.text: If there is a fire at the Gray Terminal, then this country will be clean.
quotes.speaker: Sterry
quotes.context: Sterry reveals the nobles' plan to burn Gray Terminal

events.title: Sabo Escapes to Warn His Brothers
events.description: Upon learning of the plot, Sabo immediately escapes from his mansion to warn Ace and Luffy. He overhears his father's men confirming that the Bluejam Pirates will execute the fire.
events.significance: Shows Sabo's determination to save his brothers despite having just sacrificed everything to return home. Demonstrates his true priorities and courage.

quotes.speaker: Sabo
quotes.context: Sabo's desperate cry as he runs to warn his brothers, ending the episode

quotes.speaker: Sabo
quotes.context: Sabo's declaration as he sacrifices his freedom to protect Ace and Luffy

quotes.text: I didn't know one of the three infamous brats was a Noble.
quotes.speaker: Bluejam
quotes.context: Bluejam reveals he knows Sabo's secret

quotes.text: If there is a fire at the Gray Terminal, then this country will be clean.
quotes.speaker: Sterry
Sabo
quotes.context: Sabo's desperate cry ending the episode

themes.description: Sabo sacrifices his freedom and dreams to protect Ace and Luffy, demonstrating the depth of their brotherly bond.
themes.symbolism: The broken telescope represents Sabo's shattered dreams and the price of his sacrifice for his brothers.

themes.description: The episode starkly contrasts the lives of nobles in High Town with the poor residents of Gray Terminal, showing the cruel indifference of the upper class.
themes.symbolism: Gray Terminal itself symbolizes how the nobles view the poor as 'trash' to be discarded and eliminated.
culturalReferences: Reflects real-world class struggles and the dehumanization of the poor by the wealthy

themes.description: Sabo's forced return to noble life represents the loss of freedom and the crushing of dreams under societal expectations.
themes.symbolism: Sabo being taken from Gray Terminal back to High Town symbolizes the loss of freedom and being trapped by birthright.

themes.description: The nobles' plan to burn Gray Terminal reveals the depths of corruption and evil that those in power can commit.
themes.symbolism: The planned fire represents the powerful literally burning away those they deem unworthy.

characterSpotlights.development: Sabo faces the ultimate test of his character, choosing to sacrifice his freedom to protect his brothers, then risking everything again to warn them of the nobles' plot. Shows his growth from a runaway noble to someone who truly values bonds over status.
keyActions: Fights the Bluejam Pirates alongside his brothers
Sacrifices his freedom to save Ace and Luffy
Discovers the Gray Terminal fire plot

characterSpotlights.development: Revealed as a cruel, classist noble who sees non-nobles as trash and is willing to use pirates to retrieve his son for the sake of family reputation.
keyActions: Hires Bluejam Pirates to capture Sabo
Shows disgust when Ace's blood touches him
Forces Sabo to return to High Town
quotes: You got your trashy kid's blood all over me!

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as Sabo's adopted replacement, showing calculating intelligence and complicity with the nobles' cruel plans.
keyActions: Meets Sabo for the first time
Reveals knowledge of the Gray Terminal fire plot
quotes: If there is a fire at the Gray Terminal, then this country will be clean.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended several scenes for pacing, including the brothers' search through Gray Terminal and the confrontation with Bluejam.
Additional dialogue was added to Sterry's conversation with Sabo to make the nobles' plot more explicit.

trivia.fact: Episode 500 marks a significant milestone as the 500th episode of the One Piece anime, though it focuses on a flashback rather than present-day events.
The broken telescope in this episode becomes one of the most poignant symbols in the Sabo flashback arc, representing shattered dreams and lost childhood.
This episode adapts Chapter 585 (pages 18-19) and Chapter 586 (pages 2-12), showing the slower pacing typical of the Post-War Arc.
To celebrate the 500th episode milestone, Funimation uploaded episodes 1-202 (all dubbed episodes at the time) to their website.
Sterry, who debuts in this episode, later becomes the King of Goa Kingdom, making his first appearance here particularly significant.
